title: Interpret bar graph of student volunteer activity

content.description: As part of a community service program, students in three middle school grades (grade 6, grade 7, grade 8) each chose to participate in one of three school-sponsored volunteer activities. The graph below shows the distribution for each class for the three activities.
content.question: Based on the graph, which statement must be true?

choices.label: Of all the students who chose activity B, the greatest number of students were in grade 6.
Grade 7 and grade 8 had the same number of students who did not choose activity A.
The grade with the greatest percentage of students who chose activity C was grade 8.
For students in grade 7, the number who chose activity C was greater than the number who chose activity B.
For students in grade 8, the number who chose activity A was greater than the number who chose activity B.

content.answer: For students in grade 7, the number who chose activity C was greater than the number who chose activity B.

topic.text: 1.4: Representing a Categorical Variable with Graphs

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
